messages.messageBody:
Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:
**I was working on a booger analogy first**

I get that one too, like the pesky booger on the hobbit's finger in Lord of the Rings. We love that scene, <g>
it might only be in the extended version though.

Kel

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] school as a leech,  or leach
messages.msgSnippet: Deborah Lewis  wrote: **Oh, yes, and my spelling...** I think you can spell it either way! The only reason I thought it looked different was
messages.messageBody:
Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:

**Oh, yes, and my spelling...**


I think you can spell it either way!
The only reason I thought it looked different was because we have a Leech Lake near me and Leech Lake Indian Reservation so I see that a lot around here.

It was very 'on' for me, the analogy that is.

The leechy schoolish ideas were sucking the unschooling force from me. "Kelli, feel the force" said the unschooling jedi master.

Kelli
I might have to go watch Star Wars now!Yahoo! Groups SponsorADVERTISEMENT

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] school as a leech,  or leach
messages.msgSnippet: Deborah Lewis  wrote: **If you had a big leach stuck to you wouldn t it be better if someone told you right out? ....... Well here, school
messages.messageBody:
Deborah Lewis <ddzimlew@...> wrote:
**If you had a big leach stuck to you wouldn't it be better if someone told
you right out? .......

Well here, school and anything like it is that leach stuck on you,
sucking the blood out of the life you could be having with your child.
We have the salt shaker. And maybe even a recipe for leach flambï¿½.**



Oohh, Deb, I like this!!



Kelli

E

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] So long for now...but not forever
messages.msgSnippet: ***SO I m going to unsub and see if the problem continues. *** You could just go no mail.   You re still a member of the group that way but you read at the
messages.messageBody:
***SO I'm going to unsub and see if the problem
continues. ***

You could just go no mail. You're still a member of the group that way
but you read at the yahoo groups web site instead of having mail
delivered. Or did I miss that you're not on-line. I'm so slow.

***I'll think of what has been said and I appreciate everyone's honesty
if not quite their bluntness.***

I'm sorry you don't like blunt. It seems the best we can do for each
other is to say it, get it out there and let it be digested. I hate to
see people waste one precious minute getting to a better place with their
kids. We don't have them nearly long enough as it is. It seems a damn
shame to waste any time at all.

If you had a big leach stuck to you wouldn't it be better if someone told
you right out? Would you want person after person to see the leach and
not say anything to you?
Well here, school and anything like it is that leach stuck on you,
sucking the blood out of the life you could be having with your child.
We have the salt shaker. And maybe even a recipe for leach flambÃ¨.

Hope you find a way to stay.

Deb L

messages.subject: So long for now...but not forever
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the computer suggestions..we defrag every week, ran it anyway; that didn t help neither did changing my settings or anything else we could think of.
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the computer suggestions..we defrag every week, ran it
anyway; that didn't help neither did changing my settings or anything
else we could think of. SO I'm going to unsub and see if the problem
continues.

I'll think of what has been said and I appreciate everyone's honesty
if not quite their bluntness.

With any luck I'll be back...if I'd be welcome, that is. In case
anyone wants to reply, I'll not be unsubbing just yet but within the
next couple days.

E
